title: The new Boards are Worse than Magic
body:
Fact.

People have been telling you just how shitty the boards are since you first announced them but you still went and tossed out GD. Now just about every thread here is complaining about how shitty it is. I can't fucking imagine why.

Nobody wanted this before and we sure as hell don't want it now.

replies.body: I don't really understand the problem with them. They are just like forums... would you main explaining yourself?
They are not just like forums, they are just like reddit. We want forums....

> They are not just like forums, they are just like reddit. We want forums....

They're only "like Reddit" if 1) you've never actually used Reddit and 2) you can't find the Chronological View button.
I go on reddit a lot, yes this is modeled after reddit. just worse.  the color scheme is terrible and the format is complete bogus, other than that it's a reddit clone.  tell me a difference

There's no karma, so karma whoring is non-existent.

That was easy.
They look like shit, they aren't forums in the slightest, and it's a feelgood circlejerk just like leddit.

> I don't really understand the problem with them. They are just like forums... would you main explaining yourself?

They're missing key sections like help for new players and clan/team recruitment

> I don't really understand the problem with them. They are just like forums... would you main explaining yourself?

An entire community is now being crammed into one small section called GD. If they want to discuss Esports, lore, strategy, dominion,, help and support, etc. Its being shoved into that little section and thus easily getting swept up in the sea. 

A large chunk of the community doesnt want to use the leddit style outside of GD because the chronological view is ruined by nested replies. If two conversations are active in nested, its near impossible to follow.

Also these forums are slow to load, clunky, still buggy, and doesn't work on most mobile and tablets.

>An entire community is now being crammed into one small section called GD. If they want to discuss Esports, lore, strategy, dominion,, help and support, etc. Its being shoved into that little section and thus easily getting swept up in the sea.

...What?  The GD community from the original forums was migrated into GD on the Boards, and people that want to talk about the other things you mentioned have other boards they can go to:

Esports - Esports
Lore - Story & Art
Strategy - Tips & Tricks or Gameplay & Balance, depending on the thread
Dominion - Maps & Modes
Help & Support - Help & Support

>A large chunk of the community doesnt want to use the leddit style outside of GD because the chronological view is ruined by nested replies. If two conversations are active in nested, its near impossible to follow.

This is something they are working on, to my knowledge.  It's a difficult thing to set up, because Discussion view needs to match Chronological view in the information provided without cluttering either.

>Also these forums are slow to load, clunky, still buggy, and doesn't work on most mobile and tablets.

Personally, I've noticed that the Boards is way faster than the old forums, and it also doesn't crash pretty much every day.  I agree on the mobile thing, I hope that's resolved reasonably soon.

>An entire community is now being crammed into one small section called GD. If they want to discuss Esports, lore, strategy, dominion,, help and support, etc. Its being shoved into that little section and thus easily getting swept up in the sea. 

What?! You mean as opposed to before where everything was in GD and wasn't even categorized at all? I'm sure others can speak for me as well, but any non-GD forum was painfully empty and slow with discussion and not very good if you wanted to talk about things to a lot of people. Now we have the best of both worlds: mainstream traffic sees it, and also people interested in that topic see it. If you want to look at an individual topic you simply click it and boom, you are only looking at Esports, Story & Art or what have you. 

>A large chunk of the community doesnt want to use the leddit style outside of GD because the chronological view is ruined by nested replies. If two conversations are active in nested, its near impossible to follow.

Its not perfect, but there *is* a chronological view available. As far as I can see, they have said they'd like to improve upon the confusing nature of nest replies: they have their own advantages regardless of what everyone might say.

>Also these forums are slow to load, clunky, still buggy, and doesn't work on most mobile and tablets.

I've never had a problem with loading these forums and I access them from multiple machines, including library computers. If anything, good ole GD was very clunky and slow. As for mobile access, League's entire site has never been good for that, which I agree is something that needs to be improved. And thanks to this more easily customizable Board system, that idea might not be too far off.

Everything was in GD? Certainly it had all types of conversation but to write off the other subsets as void is a complete false. The help and support, lore, roleplaying, games and dominion alone are a testament to that. Are they as busy as GD? Of course not, but at least those specific tabs allowed them to not be lost in a sea of GD, as they all are now. 

I will reinstate my point that the chronological view is near impossible to read right now if there is any nested conversations taking place. Someone butting into a conversation about " Well they way to counter teem shrooms is xxxxx" in the middle of a chronological discussion that has switched to Skarners jungle capabilities is distracting, and when this happens 4-5 times from other subjects it is derailed and lost in confusion on what is actually being discussed. A soon isn't an acceptable rebuttal either because this has been discussed at length since beta and nothing was done to address it.  

Meanwhile those active forum goers are just told: Sucks for you. You are SOL. 

See the problem and why many posters are actively irritated by the stance of these boards?

>Everything was in GD? Certainly it had all types of conversation but to write off the other subsets as void is a complete false. The help and support, lore, roleplaying, games and dominion alone are a testament to that. Are they as busy as GD? Of course not, but at least those specific tabs allowed them to not be lost in a sea of GD, as they all are now.

If you wanted your topic to be visible, you put it in GD. Otherwise you usually got a few replies and that was it. So everything was just lost in the sea of GD anyways. With this format, you get both categorized in individual topics and you are seen by the general public. If you don't want to look at *everything* you click a category you *are* interested in and you just look at that.

What I *would* like to see is a checkbox system: a system where you can select which categories it shows you currently so if you don't want to see, say, champ concepts or art, you can uncheck those.
Horrible and unclear visuals.

Because it's new and different.

That's easily 70% of the complaints. What's unfortunate is that a lot of things that the Boards are missing will go unheard because of it.

Who cares about any of the previous comments. Yes, it's too much like reddit (I hate reddit). Yes, it's too strict and less fun. But by far the biggest issue is the absolutely **ABYSMAL COLOR SCHEME**. Man it's really ugly to look at these forums. I don't even like posting because it's so hard to look at it. Requesting a white background and black letters at a minimum, *please*.

I remember when the gd color scheme got changed and everyone said it sucked. Now people want to go back to it, I'd just give it a week or two, either it'll grow on you or you'll download a skin to change the colors.

One thing I like about /r lol is that you can change the color scheme, which I hope gets implemented here to suit the desires of those who prefer brighter colors.
